title: Fact Check: Claims of govt distributing smart phones to students is false | Newsmobile
author: newsmobile.in
vclaim:
The coronavirus pandemic has affected normal school education of students across the globe and students are relying on online methods to attend classes. India is no exception either.

In this backdrop, a post has surfaced on the internet claiming that the government is distributing free Android smartphones to every student so that they can complete their education without any disruptions.

ALSO READ: Morphed picture of PM Modi shared with false COVID-19…

NewsMobile fact checked the above post and found it to be false.

On running a keyword search on Google, we did not find any credible report to back the above claim.

However, we found that the Punjab government on August 12, 2020, distributed free smartphones to students studying in Class 12th.

We further scanned through the official website of the Ministry of Education, but there was no such notification.

Meanwhile, the Press Information Bureau (PIB) in a tweet dated August 24, 2020, explicitly denied the above claim and clarified that the central government has NOT launched any such scheme.

In conclusion, the above information proves that the claim about government distributing free smartphones to students is FAKE.
